Content: i am subscribed to their newsletter and it said that Komodo is supported with 1.8.0

Author: crumb#2550
Content: so, yes this is very cool

Author: crumb#2550
Content:
quote from newsletter:

We are happy to announce a new firmware update to Trezor One, bringing new features, coin support, and enhanced security.

In an ongoing effort to backport Trezor Core from Model T to Trezor One, we have made major architectural changes to Trezor One that guarantee compatibility with future updates, so that your original hardware wallet can continue to function at full capacity for as long as you use it. We also added support for new cryptocurrencies and tokens such as PIVX, Komodo, and NIX.

This update will by default roll out daily to a randomly selected 20% of devices until all are patched. If you would like to access the updates now, please visit Beta Wallet.

Author: Cryptofist#7504
Content:
**Hello Everyone! **

Since a few bugs were fixed recently with the ROGUE Daemon, we will now have a round of testing with a bounty. 

First 25 valid entries will receive 20 KMD each.
You will need to play 5 games and document them on the sheet. 

Update daemon to latest jl777 branch
Test ROGUE gameplay, fill out the form and send to @TonyL  in DM
Please fill the testing form with valid txids and leave feedback 
You may fight til death OR play & quit , please do both versions of ending the game. 
3 runs as far as you can go are required. Level 8+
More info is on the form, please look it over carefully for instructions. 

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1DA3N6aO1QINE_zxsTXO6BfGFh0fTzCJOIkzt5gDT_e8/edit?usp=sharing

Applications deadline is 72 hours from now (20:00 GMT MAR 2) 😃

-> Head over to #cc-rogue if you have questions!  

**For a New Install of Rogue**
```git clone https://github.com/jl777/komodo
cd komodo
git checkout jl777
./zcutil/build.sh -j$(nproc) ```

**To Update TUI**
```cd ~/komodo_cryptoconditions_tui
git checkout rogue
git pull
cp -r * ~/komodo/src
```

**To Update Rogue**
```
cd ~/komodo
git checkout jl777
git pull
make clean
cd src
rm komodod komodo-cli komodo-tx *.so
cd cc
rm *.so
cd ../../..
./zcutil/build.sh -j$(nproc)
 ```

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Angelos | Coinomi Wallet as a KMD developer, I don't agree with your articles statement that they were acting ` totally irresponsibly`, they were doing a community service to prevent more people from suffering loss of funds. Also, JL doesn't tweet.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I have told everyone I know to stay away from Coinomi wallet and stand by that.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: also, I don't speak officially for KMD, just myself.

Author: Angelos | Coinomi Wallet#6729
Content: Everyone's entitled to their opinion, and I appreciate you being up front and direct. But if you consider this https://cdn.coinomi.com/static/images/support/ticket900882_medium.jpg (ticket thread of the user with our support) to match this https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Responsible_disclosure then I rest my case 😃

Author: Angelos | Coinomi Wallet#6729
Content: Note: It wasnt a JL tweet, it was a tweet of someone else, with a picture of JL advice from (most probably) a discord channel -- https://twitter.com/AltLedger/status/1100679062345834496?s=19

Author: Angelos | Coinomi Wallet#6729
Content: Also if everyone you know uses mobile clients then your advise is pointless - for reasons explained above and in our statement. The issue never affected those. And it was patched hours after disclosure anyway.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
What is your purpose in coming here Angelos, are you suggesting we shouldn't advise our community members to take precautions and remove funds from a wallet that has credible evidence it is broadcasting Seed phrases? We have an obligation to our users, if it turns out to be a false alarm so be it, but how many people should we wait to tell us there's a fire before we take it seriously? Secondly, as far as I'm concerned footnote 2 in your medium article suggests you dont actually KNOW that Google hasn't archived 400 API requests and the body text that caused it for their debugging purposes. 

I'm 100% standing behind the decision to take precautions over not. How you and the person who originally reported this dealt with the situation wasn't great, and this whole thing could have been avoided with a more understanding approach and realizing he was obviously panicking, the situation should have been diffused there, but it was handled poorly on both sides. As soon as that was out, we have an obligation to our community to warn them of potential risks.
